edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator
Class WorldPanel

java.lang.Object
  |

All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.io.Serializable
public class WorldPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

The WorldPanel class implements a custom JPanel for drawing world objects and robot animations. This panel also handles mouse events when placing or removing objects for custom world configurations.

See Also:

Change the state of the simulation (running or not running).

Parameters:
state - true if robot controller is running, else false

Removes all objects from the world.

protected void setWorldObjects(java.util.Vector wo)
Set the Vector containing world objects to the reference passed.

setHeldId

protected void setHeldId(int heldID)
Sets the heldObjectID field to the id number of any object held in the gripper.

Parameters:
heldID - id number of a gripped object, or 0 (no object held)

setEventType

protected void setEventType(int button)
Set what should happen when the mouse is clicked in this panel. Types of "events" are add, remove and move objects. None indicates that no world editing buttons are selected.

Parameters:
button - id number of recently clicked button (id numbers correspond to the named constants ROBOT, ADD, NONE)

setObjectType

protected void setObjectType(int object)
Set the type of object currently selected in the objectPanel. The default object is a BRICK.

Parameters:
object - corresonds to constants WALL, LIGHT, BALL, CAP, ROBOT

setRotationAngle

protected void setRotationAngle(float angle)
Sets angle of an object.

Parameters:
angle - angle in radians

setWorldChange

protected void setWorldChange(boolean change)
Notifies this class that a coordinate change in one or more objects has occured. This method should be replaced by an event generating/listening scheme.

Parameters:
change - true if a change has occured, false otherwise

getWorldChange

protected boolean getWorldChange()
Access status of any recent changes to object positions.

Returns:
true if a change has occured, false otherwise

getHeldObjectID

protected int getHeldObjectID()
Access the current id number for any object in the gripper (held).

Returns:
id number of gripped object, 0 if no object is held
